troubleshooting.solution: Several possible causes: 1) Your internet disconnected mid-upload - check connection and try again, 2) The file is corrupted - try opening the file on your computer first to make sure it's not broken, 3) Server is down - wait a few minutes and try again, 4) File name has special characters - try renaming the file to something simple (like 'lecture1.pdf' instead of 'Aula #1 - Introdução @2024!.pdf').

troubleshooting.problem: I uploaded multiple files but only some appear in the list!
troubleshooting.solution: Did all of them finish uploading? Check that you WAITED for each upload to complete (100%) before uploading the next one! If you start multiple uploads at once, some might fail. Upload ONE AT A TIME to be safe!

troubleshooting.problem: Can I upload the same file to multiple modules?
troubleshooting.solution: YES! If you have a file that's relevant to multiple modules, you need to upload it SEPARATELY to each module. Files aren't shared between modules - each module has its own independent file library.

troubleshooting.problem: I uploaded files but students say they can't see them!
troubleshooting.solution: Check two things: 1) Did you PREPARE THE MODULE? (See next section), 2) Does the token you gave students have 'Allow File Access' permission? If the token doesn't allow file access, students can chat but can't download files!

troubleshooting.problem: Can I upload folders/multiple files at once?
troubleshooting.solution: No! Currently you can only upload ONE FILE AT A TIME. If you have 10 files, you need to upload them one by one. This ensures each file is processed correctly. Take your time - you can upload them all in one sitting!

tips: 💡 Use DESCRIPTIVE FILE NAMES! Instead of 'doc1.pdf', use 'Week1-Introduction-To-Programming.pdf'. This makes it easy to find files later!
💡 ORGANIZE files by topic or week! If you have 'Week 1 Lecture.pdf', 'Week 1 Exercises.pdf', 'Week 1 Solutions.pdf', they'll appear together in the list (usually alphabetically)!
💡 Upload files BEFORE preparing the module! It's more efficient to upload ALL your files first, THEN click 'Prepare Module' once. This saves time!
💡 You can DOWNLOAD your own files! Click the DOWNLOAD icon next to any file to get a copy back. This is useful if you need to check what version you uploaded!
💡 Regularly UPDATE old files! If you have an updated version of a lecture, DELETE the old one and UPLOAD the new one. Then RE-PREPARE the module so the AI uses the latest version!
💡 Don't upload EVERYTHING at once! Start with the most important files (like main lecture slides and required readings). You can always add more files later!

creatingTokens.title: HOW TO CREATE TOKENS (Access Keys for Students) - COMPLETE TUTORIAL
creatingTokens.whatIs: A TOKEN is like a SPECIAL KEY or PASSWORD that students use to ACCESS the AI tutor! Think of it like this: You have a ROOM (the module) with an AI tutor inside. The TOKEN is the KEY that opens the door to that room! Each module can have MULTIPLE tokens (multiple keys) that you give to different groups of students.
creatingTokens.why: WHY create tokens? Because you need a way to CONTROL who can access your module! You don't want the whole internet using your AI tutor - you only want YOUR students! Tokens also let you: 1) Control what students can do (chat only? or also download files?), 2) Set expiration dates (so the token stops working after the semester ends), 3) Track usage (see how many times the token was used).

steps.title: GO TO 'Module Tokens' page
steps.desc: Click on 'MODULE TOKENS' or 'Module Tokens' in the LEFT MENU. You'll see a page showing ALL your tokens (if you have any). If this is your first time, the list will be EMPTY.

steps.title: CLICK 'Generate Token' or 'Create Token'
steps.desc: Look for a BLUE BUTTON at the TOP RIGHT that says 'GENERATE TOKEN' or 'Create Token' or 'New Token'. CLICK on it! A FORM (dialog box) will open where you'll fill in the token details.

steps.title: SELECT which MODULE this token is for
steps.desc: The FIRST field is usually 'Module' or 'Select Module'. Click the DROPDOWN and SELECT which module this token will unlock. For example, if you want students to access your 'Introduction to Python - Week 1' module, select that module from the list!

steps.title: GIVE the token a NAME
steps.desc: The second field is 'Token Name'. Give it a DESCRIPTIVE name so you know what it's for later! Example: 'Fall 2024 - Section A', 'Moodle Widget - CS101', 'WhatsApp Group Token'. Don't just write 'Token 1' - be specific about WHERE or WHO will use this token!

steps.title: ADD a description (OPTIONAL but recommended)
steps.desc: There's usually a 'Description' field. This is OPTIONAL but helpful! Write something like: 'Token for CS101 students enrolled in Moodle course' or 'For private tutoring students'. This helps you remember the purpose of each token later!

steps.title: SET expiration (OPTIONAL)
steps.desc: There's a field called 'Expires in (days)' or 'Expiration'. This is OPTIONAL! If you LEAVE IT EMPTY, the token will NEVER EXPIRE (works forever). If you FILL IT IN, enter a NUMBER of days. Example: '120' means the token will work for 120 days from today, then automatically stop working. Good for semester-based courses!

steps.title: CONFIGURE PERMISSIONS - Allow Chat?
steps.desc: You'll see a CHECKBOX or TOGGLE that says 'Allow Chat' or 'Chat Permission'. If you CHECK THIS (turn it ON), students can ASK QUESTIONS to the AI tutor. If you UNCHECK IT (turn it OFF), students can only access files but can't chat. MOST OF THE TIME you want this ON!

steps.title: CONFIGURE PERMISSIONS - Allow File Access?
steps.desc: Another CHECKBOX/TOGGLE says 'Allow File Access' or 'File Permission'. If you CHECK THIS, students can DOWNLOAD the files you uploaded to the module. If you UNCHECK IT, students can ask the AI about the files, but can't download them directly. Typically you want this ON too!

steps.title: CLICK 'Create Token' or 'Generate'
steps.desc: After filling everything in, look for the BLUE BUTTON at the bottom that says 'CREATE TOKEN' or 'Generate' or 'Save'. CLICK on it! The system will create your token.

steps.title: COPY the token!
steps.desc: After creating, you'll see the TOKEN STRING (a long text like 'abc123xyz456...'). There should be a 'COPY' button or 'Copy Token' button. CLICK on it to copy the token to your clipboard. You'll need this to share with students!

creatingTokens.whatYouShouldSee: After creating the token: You should see the token in the TOKEN LIST with: Name, Module, Status (Active), Expiration date (or 'Never'), Permissions (Chat/Files), and Actions. The token string itself is usually HIDDEN for security, but you can VIEW it or COPY it by clicking the view/copy icons.

distribution.title: HOW TO DISTRIBUTE TOKENS TO STUDENTS

methods.desc: BEST METHOD for most professors! In Moodle: 1) Create an 'External Tool' or 'URL' resource, 2) Paste the widget URL with your token: https://widget.tutoria.ai/?module_token=YOUR_TOKEN_HERE, 3) Students click on it inside Moodle and the widget opens!
Send an email to all students with: 'Click this link to access the AI tutor: https://widget.tutoria.ai/?module_token=YOUR_TOKEN_HERE'. Students click the link and the widget opens in their browser!
Post the widget link in your class WhatsApp/Telegram group: 'AI Tutor link: https://widget.tutoria.ai/?module_token=YOUR_TOKEN_HERE'. Students can save it and access anytime!
Post an 'Announcement' or 'Material' in Google Classroom with the widget URL. Students can access it directly from Classroom!

Use a QR Code generator website (like qr-code-generator.com) to convert the widget URL into a QR CODE. Put the QR code on slides, printouts, or show on screen. Students scan with their phones to access!

commonMistakes.mistake: I created the token but students say it doesn't work!
commonMistakes.solution: Check these things: 1) Did you PREPARE THE MODULE? Tokens only work after the module is prepared! 2) Is 'Allow Chat' enabled? If not, students can't ask questions! 3) Did you copy the FULL token string? Sometimes people copy only part of it. 4) Has the token expired? Check the expiration date!

commonMistakes.mistake: I forgot to copy the token after creating it!
commonMistakes.solution: No problem! Go to the MODULE TOKENS page, find your token in the list, and click the VIEW icon (👁️ eye) or COPY icon (📋 clipboard) to see/copy the token again!

commonMistakes.mistake: Students can chat but say they can't download files!
commonMistakes.solution: Check the token PERMISSIONS! Go to Module Tokens, find your token, and click EDIT. Make sure 'Allow File Access' is CHECKED (turned ON). If it was off, turn it on and save. Students should now be able to download files!

commonMistakes.mistake: I want to create separate tokens for different sections of the same course!
commonMistakes.solution: GREAT IDEA! Create MULTIPLE tokens for the SAME MODULE with different names! Example: 'Section A - Morning Class', 'Section B - Afternoon Class'. This way you can track which section uses the AI more, and you can revoke one section's access without affecting the other!

commonMistakes.mistake: The token expired and students can't access anymore!
commonMistakes.solution: You have 2 options: 1) CREATE A NEW TOKEN (easier) - make a new token for the same module and share the new link with students, 2) EDIT THE EXISTING TOKEN (if the system allows) - but usually it's easier to just create a fresh token!

commonMistakes.mistake: I want to stop students from using the AI but keep the token for later!
commonMistakes.solution: You can DEACTIVATE or DELETE the token! Go to Module Tokens, find the token, and click the DELETE icon. This immediately stops the token from working. Students who try to use it will see an error. You can create a new token anytime to re-enable access!

troubleshooting.problem: I can't create a token because there are no modules in the dropdown!
troubleshooting.solution: You need to CREATE A MODULE FIRST! Tokens are tied to modules. If you don't have any modules, go create one first (see 'How to Create Modules' section), THEN come back and create a token for that module!

troubleshooting.problem: The 'Generate Token' button is not appearing!
troubleshooting.solution: Check your permissions! Are you an Admin Professor or a Regular Professor assigned to this course? If you're a Regular Professor but not assigned to any courses, you won't see the button. Contact your Admin Professor!

troubleshooting.problem: Can I use the same token for multiple modules?
troubleshooting.solution: NO! Each token is for ONE SPECIFIC MODULE! If you have 5 modules, you need 5 tokens (or however many you want per module). This is intentional - it allows you to control access per module!

troubleshooting.problem: Students are complaining the widget is too slow!
troubleshooting.solution: This is usually NOT related to the token - it's either: 1) The student's internet is slow, 2) The AI system is overloaded (rare), 3) The module has HUGE files and the AI is processing them (happens with very large PDFs). Unfortunately you can't control this from the token side!

troubleshooting.problem: Can I see how many times a token was used?
troubleshooting.solution: YES! In the Module Tokens list, you should see a column like 'Usage Count' or 'Requests' that shows how many times the token was used. Click on VIEW for a token to see detailed stats!

tips: 💡 Use DESCRIPTIVE NAMES! 'Fall 2024 Moodle Section A' is way better than 'Token 1'!

💡 Set EXPIRATION DATES for semester-based courses! Example: If your semester ends in 120 days, set expiration to 120 days. This prevents students from using it in future semesters with different content!
💡 Create BACKUP TOKENS! Make 2 tokens for the same module - one PRIMARY (share with students) and one BACKUP (keep secret). If you need to revoke the primary, you have a backup ready!
💡 Test the token YOURSELF before sharing with students! Copy the widget URL and open it in your browser. Ask the AI a question to make sure everything works!
💡 MONITOR token usage! Check the usage count periodically. If a token has 0 uses after a week, maybe students didn't get the link or don't know how to use it - check in with them!
💡 For LARGE CLASSES, use LMS integration (Moodle/Canvas)! Don't send individual links - embed the widget in your LMS so students access it where they're already comfortable!
💡 Keep a SPREADSHEET or NOTE of which tokens you created for which purpose! With many modules and tokens, it's easy to forget which is which!

preparingModules.title: HOW TO PREPARE MODULES - Making Everything READY for Students!
preparingModules.whatIs: PREPARING A MODULE is the FINAL STEP before students can use your AI tutor! Think of it like this: You've 1) Created the room (module), 2) Put books inside (uploaded files), 3) Made keys (tokens)... but the AI tutor hasn't READ the books yet! 'Preparing' = Sending ALL your files to OpenAI's system and creating the ACTUAL AI assistant that will chat with students!
preparingModules.why: WHY is this necessary? Because uploading files to Tutoria is NOT the same as making them available to the AI! When you 'Prepare', the system: 1) Sends all your files to OpenAI, 2) Creates a specialized AI assistant with your System Prompt, 3) Links everything together so students can use it. Without preparing, the AI has NOTHING to work with!

prerequisites.title: BEFORE YOU PREPARE - Checklist
items: ✅ You MUST have created at least ONE TOKEN with 'Allow Chat' permission! (The system needs a token to create the AI assistant)
✅ You SHOULD have uploaded files to the module (optional but highly recommended - otherwise the AI only has general knowledge)
✅ You SHOULD have configured a System Prompt (optional but recommended - this tells the AI how to behave)

steps.title: GO TO the MODULE PAGE
steps.desc: Click on 'Modules' in the left menu, then click on the NAME of the module you want to prepare. You'll see the module detail page with files, tokens, etc.

steps.title: MAKE SURE you have at least 1 token created!
steps.desc: Look at the 'ACCESS TOKENS' section on the module page. You should see at least ONE token in the list! If the list is EMPTY, go create a token first (see the section above). You CANNOT prepare without a token!

steps.title: FIND the 'PREPARE MODULE' button
steps.desc: Look at the TOP of the module page, near the 'Edit Module' button. You should see a button that says 'PREPARE MODULE' or 'Prepare'. It's usually GREEN or BLUE.

steps.title: CLICK 'Prepare Module'
steps.desc: Click the button! The system will start the preparation process. You'll see a LOADING indicator (spinning circle or similar).

steps.title: WAIT for the process to complete
steps.desc: This usually takes 5-30 SECONDS depending on how many files you have! The system is: 1) Uploading all files to OpenAI, 2) Creating an AI assistant, 3) Configuring everything. DO NOT CLOSE THE PAGE while this is happening! Just wait patiently!

preparingModules.whatYouShouldSee: After successful preparation: You should see a GREEN SUCCESS MESSAGE that says something like 'Module prepared successfully!' or 'Files have been uploaded to OpenAI and the assistant is ready'. The module is now LIVE and students can use it!

testing.title: HOW TO TEST if it worked

steps.desc: Copy one of your module TOKENS (from the Access Tokens section)
Open a NEW BROWSER TAB or window
Paste this URL (replacing YOUR_TOKEN_HERE with your actual token): https://widget.tutoria.ai/?module_token=YOUR_TOKEN_HERE
Press ENTER. The AI tutor widget should OPEN!
Ask a question related to your uploaded files! Example: If you uploaded a PDF about Python variables, ask 'What are the different types of variables in Python?'
Check if the AI responds using information from YOUR files (not just general knowledge). If it mentions specific things from your PDFs, SUCCESS! It's working!

commonMistakes.mistake: I clicked 'Prepare Module' but it says 'No tokens available'!
commonMistakes.solution: You need to CREATE A TOKEN FIRST! Go to the 'Module Tokens' page (or the Access Tokens section on the module page), create a token with 'Allow Chat' enabled, THEN try preparing again!

commonMistakes.mistake: It says 'Invalid token' when I try to prepare!
commonMistakes.solution: The token needs to have 'Allow Chat' permission ENABLED! Check your token - if 'Allow Chat' is turned OFF, turn it ON, save the token, and try preparing again!

commonMistakes.mistake: The preparation completed but the AI doesn't know about my files!
commonMistakes.solution: Did you upload the files BEFORE preparing? If you uploaded files AFTER preparing, the AI won't have them! You need to RE-PREPARE the module: Just click 'Prepare Module' again! This will update the AI with the new files!

commonMistakes.mistake: I made changes to the System Prompt and want the AI to use the new version!
commonMistakes.solution: RE-PREPARE THE MODULE! Whenever you change the System Prompt, you need to prepare again for the changes to take effect. Click 'Prepare Module' and it will update the AI assistant!

commonMistakes.mistake: The preparation got stuck and never completed!
commonMistakes.solution: Wait 2-3 minutes to be sure. If it's still stuck: 1) REFRESH the page, 2) Try clicking 'Prepare Module' again. If it fails repeatedly, it might be a temporary server issue - wait 10-15 minutes and try again, or contact support if it persists!

commonMistakes.mistake: Can I prepare the module multiple times?
commonMistakes.solution: YES! You can (and should) RE-PREPARE whenever you: 1) Add new files, 2) Delete files, 3) Change the System Prompt. Re-preparing updates everything! It doesn't hurt to prepare multiple times!

troubleshooting.problem: The 'Prepare Module' button is not visible!
troubleshooting.solution: Possible reasons: 1) You're not on the MODULE DETAIL PAGE - make sure you clicked into an individual module, 2) You don't have permission - are you an Admin Professor or assigned to this module? 3) The module is already being prepared - wait for it to finish!

troubleshooting.problem: Preparation failed with error 'OpenAI error'!
troubleshooting.solution: This usually means: 1) OpenAI's system is temporarily down (rare) - wait and try again later, 2) One of your files is corrupted or incompatible - try removing files one by one and preparing again to identify the problematic file, 3) Contact support if it keeps happening!

troubleshooting.problem: How long does preparation usually take?
troubleshooting.solution: NORMAL: 5-30 seconds for modules with a few files. LONGER: 30-60 seconds for modules with many large files (like 10 PDFs of 40MB each). If it takes more than 2 minutes, something might be wrong - check your internet connection!

troubleshooting.problem: I deleted a file and re-prepared but the AI still mentions that file!
troubleshooting.solution: This shouldn't happen, but if it does: 1) Try preparing again (sometimes it needs 2 attempts), 2) Check if the file is REALLY deleted (refresh the page and check the files list), 3) If it persists, it might be an AI caching issue - wait 5-10 minutes and test again!

troubleshooting.problem: Does preparing cost money or use up credits?
troubleshooting.solution: That depends on your institution's setup! Some systems have unlimited preparations, others might have quotas. Check with your Super Administrator or the person who set up your Tutoria account. USUALLY there's no limit for professors!

tips: 💡 PREPARE EARLY! Don't wait until the day before class starts! Prepare a week early and TEST thoroughly so you have time to fix issues!
💡 RE-PREPARE after ANY changes! Changed the System Prompt? Re-prepare. Added files? Re-prepare. This ensures students always have the latest version!
💡 TEST YOURSELF before sharing with students! After preparing, use the widget yourself! Ask questions, download files, make sure everything works!

💡 If you're updating files mid-semester, TELL STUDENTS! Send a message like 'I updated the study materials - the AI tutor now has the latest version!' so they know to ask questions about the new content!
💡 Keep a PREPARATION LOG! Write down when you prepared each module (like 'CS101-W1: Prepared on Jan 15, 2024 with 5 PDFs'). This helps track what's current!
💡 Don't OVER-PREPARE! You don't need to prepare every hour! Only re-prepare when you make actual changes. Preparing 50 times in a day doesn't make it better!
💡 If you have 10 modules, you need to prepare each one SEPARATELY! Preparing Module 1 doesn't automatically prepare Modules 2-10. Do them one by one!

finalChecklist.title: FINAL CHECKLIST - Is My Module REALLY Ready for Students?
items: ✅ Module created with good name and description?
✅ System Prompt configured (AI knows how to teach)?
✅ At least 1 token created with proper permissions?
✅ Module PREPARED (clicked the Prepare button and saw success)?
✅ TESTED the widget yourself (asked questions, downloaded files)?
✅ Widget link shared with students (Moodle, email, WhatsApp, etc.)?
✅ Students know HOW to use the AI tutor (maybe provide instructions)?
✅ You're monitoring usage (checking token stats occasionally)?
✅ You have a plan to update content and re-prepare as needed?

regularProfessor.title: Guide for Regular Professors
regularProfessor.subtitle: Super detailed guide for regular professors. This guide is VERY similar to the Admin Professor guide, but you will have some access differences!
regularProfessor.note: NOTE: As a Regular Professor, you can do ALMOST EVERYTHING an Admin Professor does, EXCEPT: Create other professors, View all university courses (you only see yours). For creating modules, uploading files, configuring AI tutors, creating tokens, preparing modules - IT'S ALL THE SAME! Follow the same tutorials from the 'Admin Professor' section above.

viewing.title: Viewing Course Details
tabs: Modules Tab: All modules for this course, filterable by semester and year
Professors Tab: All professors assigned to this course
Students Tab: All students enrolled in this course (when implemented)
actions: Add Module: Create a new module for this course
View University: Navigate to your university page

editing.title: Editing a Course
steps: From the course detail page, click 'Edit Course'
Update the course name, code, or description
Clique em 'Salvar Alterações' para atualizar

deleting.title: Deleting a Course
deleting.warning: ⚠️ Warning: Deleting a course will also delete all its modules and associated content. This cannot be undone.
steps: From the Courses list, click the delete icon on the course row
Confirme a exclusão
The course and all its modules will be permanently removed

regularProfessor.title: Guia do Professor Regular
regularProfessor.subtitle: Guia super detalhado para professores regulares. Este guia é MUITO similar ao guia de Professor Administrador, mas você terá algumas diferenças de acesso!
regularProfessor.note: NOTA: Como Professor Regular, você pode fazer QUASE TUDO que o Professor Administrador faz, EXCETO: Criar outros professores, Ver todas as disciplinas da universidade (só vê as suas). Para criar módulos, fazer upload de arquivos, configurar tutores de IA, criar tokens, preparar módulos - É TUDO IGUAL! Siga os mesmos tutoriais da seção 'Professor Administrador' acima. Todas as instruções de módulos, arquivos, tokens e preparação se aplicam a você também!

modules.title: Managing Modules
modules.description: Modules are individual learning units within a course. Each module can have files, an AI tutor, and access tokens.

creating.title: Creating a Module
steps: Navigate to Modules (/modules) or click 'Create Module' from the dashboard
Fill in the required information:
• Module Name (e.g., 'Data Structures and Algorithms')
• Module Code (e.g., 'CS101-M1')
• Course (select from your courses)
• Semester and Year (optional)
• Description (optional but recommended)
Configure the AI Tutor (optional):
• Choose a template or write a custom system prompt
• The system prompt defines how the AI tutor behaves
• Select the AI tutor language
• You can improve the prompt up to 3 times in 72 hours
Clique em 'Criar Módulo' para salvar

aiTutor.title: Configuring the AI Tutor
aiTutor.description: The AI tutor system prompt defines how the AI assistant responds to student questions.

templates.title: Quick Templates
list: General Tutor: A helpful tutor for general learning
Programming Tutor: Specialized for programming and CS concepts
Math & Science Tutor: Focused on mathematical and scientific concepts
Research Assistant: Support for academic research and writing

customizing.title: Escrevendo Prompts Personalizados
tips: Define the AI's role and expertise clearly
Specify teaching style and approach
Include guidelines for different question types
Set expectations for response format and tone
Consider your target audience and their level
Example: 'You are a patient programming teacher who uses everyday examples and always breaks down complex concepts into simple steps'

improving.title: Improving Prompts with AI
improving.description: After saving a module, you can use the 'Improve with AI' feature to enhance your system prompt. You get 3 improvements per module every 72 hours.

uploadingFiles.title: Enviando Arquivos para Módulos
uploadingFiles.description: Upload educational materials that students can access through the AI tutor widget.
steps: Navigate to the module detail page (/modules/{id})
Clique no botão 'Enviar Arquivo'
Select a file from your computer (or drag and drop)
Formatos suportados: PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT, PPT, PPTX
Tamanho máximo de arquivo: 50MB
Click 'Upload File' to add it to the module
Files are automatically indexed for the AI tutor

managing.title: Managing Files
actions: Download: Download a copy of any file
Delete: Remove a file from the module (with confirmation)

preparingModule.title: Preparing a Module
preparingModule.description: Before students can use the AI tutor, you need to 'prepare' the module. This uploads all files to OpenAI and creates the AI assistant.
prerequisites: The module must have at least one active token with chat permission
The module should have an AI tutor system prompt configured
Files should be uploaded (optional but recommended)
steps: Navegue até a página de detalhes do módulo
Click 'Prepare Module' button
Aguarde a conclusão do processo de preparação
Once prepared, the AI tutor is ready for students
preparingModule.note: Note: You can update files and re-prepare the module at any time.

tokens.title: Managing Module Tokens
tokens.description: Module tokens provide secure access to AI tutoring widgets. Each token controls what students can do (chat, access files, etc.).

creating.title: Criando um Token
steps: Navigate to Module Tokens (/tokens)
Click 'Generate Token'
Fill in the token details:
• Select the module
• Token Name (e.g., 'Moodle Widget 2024')
• Description (optional)
• Expiration (optional, in days)
Configure permissions:
• Allow Chat: Students can ask questions to the AI tutor
• Allow File Access: Students can download module files
Click 'Create Token'
Copy the generated token - you'll need it for the widget

using.title: Usando Tokens
using.description: Tokens are used to embed the AI tutor widget in your LMS or website.
using.security: Keep tokens secure and only share them through official channels.

managing.title: Gerenciando Tokens
actions: View: See token details and statistics
Edit: Update token name, description, or permissions
Copy: Copy the token to clipboard

bestPractices.title: Melhores Práticas de Tokens
list: Use descriptive names that indicate where the token is used
Set expiration dates for tokens used in temporary contexts
Disable chat or file access if not needed
Monitor token usage through the statistics
Revoke tokens that are no longer in use
Create separate tokens for different LMS courses or contexts

professors.title: Gerenciando Professores
professors.description: As an admin professor, you can create regular professor accounts and assign them to courses within your university.

creating.title: Creating a Regular Professor
steps: Navigate to Professors (/professors)
Click 'Add Professor'
Select 'Regular Professor' type
Fill in the professor information:
• First Name and Last Name
• Username (will be used for login)
• Email address
• Temporary Password
Your university is automatically selected
Select one or more courses to assign
Click 'Create Professor'
Copy and securely share the password setup link
The link expires in 72 hours

assigning.title: Course Assignments
assigning.description: Regular professors can only view and manage modules for courses they are assigned to. You can assign multiple courses during creation.
assigning.updating: To change course assignments, you'll need to edit the professor from their detail page (coming soon).

managing.title: Managing Professor Accounts
actions: Activate: Enable a deactivated professor account
Deactivate: Temporarily disable a professor account
Delete: Permanently remove a professor (super admin only)

workflow.title: Recommended Workflow
workflow.description: Follow this workflow for setting up a new course:
steps: 1. Create the course with name, code, and description
2. Create modules for the course (one per topic/unit)
3. Configure AI tutor prompts for each module
4. Upload educational files to modules
5. Create regular professors and assign them to the course
6. Generate module access tokens
7. Prepare modules for student use
8. Share widget links with students through your LMS

bestPractices.title: Melhores Práticas
list: Use clear, descriptive names for courses and modules
Write detailed AI tutor prompts that match your teaching style
Upload comprehensive materials before preparing modules
Create separate tokens for different student groups or LMS courses
Regularly review and update module content
Use the 'Improve with AI' feature to refine tutor prompts
Set expiration dates on tokens for semester-based courses
Monitor professor and token usage regularly
Keep course codes consistent across semesters
Document your course structure and token usage

overview.title: Visão Geral da Função
overview.description: Como Professor, você pode gerenciar módulos para cursos aos quais foi atribuído. Você pode criar módulos, configurar tutores de IA, enviar arquivos e gerar tokens de acesso para seus alunos.
responsibilities: Criar e gerenciar módulos para cursos atribuídos
Configurar prompts do sistema de tutor de IA
Enviar conteúdo educacional e arquivos
Gerar e gerenciar tokens de acesso de módulo
Preparar módulos para uso dos estudantes
Monitorar uso de módulos e engajamento de estudantes

gettingStarted.title: Primeiros Passos
gettingStarted.step1Desc: Use o link de configuração de senha fornecido pelo seu administrador para definir sua senha. Após definir sua senha, você pode fazer login com seu nome de usuário.
gettingStarted.step2Desc: Seu painel (/dashboard) mostra ações rápidas: Criar Módulo, Ver Cursos, Ver Módulos e Gerenciar Tokens.
gettingStarted.step3Desc: Navegue até Cursos (/courses) para ver todos os cursos aos quais você foi atribuído pelo seu administrador.
gettingStarted.step4Desc: Selecione um curso e crie seu primeiro módulo para começar a construir seu conteúdo educacional.

courses.title: Working with Courses
courses.description: You can view details of courses you've been assigned to, but you cannot create or edit courses. Contact your admin professor if you need course changes.

viewing.title: Viewing Course Details
steps: Navigate to Courses (/courses)
Click on any course you're assigned to
View course information, modules, professors, and students
Use the 'Add Module' button to create a new module for this course

limitations.title: Course Limitations
limitations.description: As a regular professor, you cannot:
list: Create new courses
Edit existing courses
Delete courses
Atribuir outros professores a cursos
limitations.note: If you need to create or modify courses, contact your university's admin professor.

modules.title: Managing Your Modules
modules.description: Modules are the core of your teaching content. You can create, edit, and manage modules for your assigned courses.

creating.title: Creating a Module
steps: Navigate to Modules (/modules) or click 'Create Module'
Fill in the module details:
• Module Name (e.g., 'Introduction to Python Programming')
• Module Code (e.g., 'CS101-W1')
• Select your course from the dropdown
• Semester and Year (optional but recommended)
• Description (optional but helpful for students)
Configure the AI Tutor:
• Choose a quick template OR write a custom prompt
• Define how the AI tutor should interact with students
• Select the tutor's response language
Clique em 'Criar Módulo' para salvar

aiTutor.title: Configuring the AI Tutor
aiTutor.description: The AI tutor is your virtual teaching assistant. Configure it to match your teaching style and course objectives.

templates.title: Using Templates
templates.description: Quick templates provide pre-written prompts for common teaching scenarios:
options: Programming Tutor: For computer science and coding courses
Math & Science Tutor: For STEM subjects
Research Assistant: For research methods and academic writing

customPrompts.title: Escrevendo Prompts Personalizados
customPrompts.description: Create a unique teaching personality for your AI tutor:
tips: Start with: 'You are a [type] tutor for [subject]...'
Describe the teaching approach (e.g., 'patient', 'socratic', 'step-by-step')
Set boundaries (e.g., 'Don't give direct answers, guide students to solutions')
Specify response format (e.g., 'Use bullet points for lists')
Consider student level (e.g., 'Assume basic high school math knowledge')
customPrompts.example: Example: 'You are a patient Python programming tutor for beginners. Always explain concepts using real-world analogies. When a student asks for code, provide it with detailed comments explaining each line. Encourage students to try solutions before giving the answer.'

improving.title: Improving Prompts
steps: After saving your module, click 'Edit Module'
Scroll to the AI Tutor Configuration section
Click 'Improve with AI' to enhance your prompt
The AI will rewrite your prompt to be more effective
You can improve up to 3 times per module every 72 hours
Review the improved prompt and save if satisfied

language.title: Tutor Language Settings
language.description: Select the language your AI tutor should use when responding to students. This is independent of the student's question language - the tutor will respond in the selected language regardless of how the question is asked.

files.title: Managing Module Files
files.description: Upload course materials that the AI tutor can reference when helping students.

uploading.title: Enviando Arquivos
steps: Navigate to your module detail page (/modules/{id})
Click 'Upload File' in the Files section
Select or drag and drop your file
Formatos suportados: PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT, PPT, PPTX
Maximum size: 50MB per file
Click 'Upload File' to add it
The file will be indexed and available to the AI tutor

bestPractices.title: File Upload Best Practices
list: Upload lecture slides, notes, and readings
Include problem sets and examples
Add supplementary materials and references
Use clear, descriptive filenames
Upload files before preparing the module
Update files as your course progresses
Remove outdated materials regularly

managing.title: Managing Files
actions: Download: Get a copy of any uploaded file
Delete: Remove a file from the module (requires confirmation)

preparing.title: Preparando Módulos
preparing.description: Before students can use your module, you must 'prepare' it. This process uploads your files to OpenAI and creates the AI assistant.

requirements.title: Pré-requisitos
list: At least one active module access token with chat permission
AI tutor system prompt configured (recommended)
Files uploaded (optional but recommended)

steps.title: Preparation Steps
list: Ensure you have created a token for the module
Navegue até a página de detalhes do módulo
Click 'Prepare Module' button
Wait for the preparation to complete (usually a few seconds)
You'll see a success message when ready
The AI tutor is now ready for students

updating.title: Updating a Prepared Module
updating.description: You can add or remove files at any time. After making changes, click 'Prepare Module' again to update the AI tutor with the new content.

editing.title: Editing Modules
steps: From the Modules list or module detail page, click 'Edit'
Update module information, AI tutor prompt, or settings
You cannot change the course after creation
Clique em 'Salvar Alterações' para atualizar

deleting.title: Deleting Modules
deleting.warning: ⚠️ Warning: Deleting a module removes all its files, tokens, and student interaction history. This cannot be undone.
steps: From the Modules list, click the delete icon
Confirme a exclusão
The module and all its content will be permanently removed

tokens.title: Module Access Tokens
tokens.description: Tokens provide secure access to your AI tutor widget. Create tokens to share your modules with students.

creating.title: Criando um Token
steps: Navigate to Module Tokens (/tokens)
Click 'Generate Token'
Select your module from the dropdown
Fill in token details:
• Token Name (e.g., 'Fall 2024 - Section A')
• Description (optional, e.g., 'For CS101 Moodle course')
• Expiration in days (optional, e.g., 120 for semester-long)
Set permissions:
• Allow Chat: Let students ask questions
• Allow File Access: Let students download files
Click 'Create Token'
Copy the token - you'll need it for the widget

chat.title: Allow Chat
chat.description: When enabled, students can ask questions to the AI tutor. Disable this if you only want to share files without AI interaction.

fileAccess.title: Allow File Access
fileAccess.description: When enabled, students can download module files. Disable this if you want files to be AI-accessible only without direct downloads.

using.title: Using Tokens in Your LMS
using.description: Embed the AI tutor widget in your Learning Management System (Moodle, Canvas, Blackboard, etc.):
steps: Copy your module token
Use the widget URL: https://widget.tutoria.ai/?module_token=YOUR_TOKEN
Add this URL as an external tool or iframe in your LMS
Students can now interact with your AI tutor through the LMS

editing.title: Editando Tokens
editing.description: Update token name, description, or permissions without changing the token string.

revoking.title: Revogando Tokens
revoking.description: Delete a token to immediately revoke access. Students will no longer be able to use the widget with that token.

bestPractices.title: Melhores Práticas de Tokens
list: Create separate tokens for different sections or semesters
Use descriptive names that include course code and term
Set expiration dates aligned with your course end date
Monitor token usage to track student engagement
Revoke tokens after the course ends
Mantenha os tokens seguros - não os compartilhe publicamente
Test the widget with the token before sharing with students
Create a backup token in case you need to revoke the primary one

workflow.title: Fluxo de Trabalho Típico
workflow.description: Follow this workflow for each module you create:
steps: 1. Create the module with basic information
2. Write or select an AI tutor system prompt
3. Upload your course materials (slides, notes, readings)
4. Review and improve the AI tutor prompt if needed
5. Create a module access token for your students
6. Prepare the module (uploads files to AI and creates assistant)
7. Test the widget with your token to ensure it works
8. Share the widget link in your LMS or with students
9. Monitor usage and update content as needed
10. At the end of the semester, revoke tokens or set new ones for next term

modulePreparation.title: Problemas de Preparação de Módulo
modulePreparation.noTokens: Error: 'No tokens available' - Create at least one active token with chat permission before preparing.
modulePreparation.invalidToken: Error: 'Invalid token' - Ensure the token is active and has chat permission enabled.
modulePreparation.preparationFailed: If preparation fails, check that your files are under 50MB and in supported formats.

fileUploads.title: Problemas de Envio de Arquivo
fileUploads.tooLarge: File too large: Split large PDFs or compress files to under 50MB.
fileUploads.unsupportedFormat: Unsupported format: Convert files to PDF, DOC, DOCX, TXT, PPT, or PPTX.
fileUploads.uploadFailed: Upload failed: Check your internet connection and try again.

tokenIssues.title: Problemas de Token
tokenIssues.widgetNotWorking: Widget not working: Verify the token is active and the module is prepared.
tokenIssues.chatDisabled: Students can't chat: Enable 'Allow Chat' permission on the token.
tokenIssues.filesNotAccessible: Files not accessible: Enable 'Allow File Access' permission or re-prepare the module.

permissions.title: Problemas de Permissão
permissions.cannotCreateCourse: Cannot create courses: Only admin professors can create courses. Ask your administrator.
permissions.cannotEditCourse: Cannot edit courses: Contact your admin professor to modify course details.
permissions.cannotSeeModule: Cannot see a module: Modules are filtered by your assigned courses. Ask to be assigned to the course.

tips.title: Pro Tips
list: Use the 'Improve with AI' feature to refine your tutor prompts - it often produces better results
Upload files in a logical order (e.g., Week 1, Week 2) for better AI organization
Test your AI tutor by asking it questions students might ask
Include course policies and FAQ documents for the AI to reference
Update your tutor prompt mid-semester if you notice areas for improvement
Create multiple tokens for A/B testing different AI configurations
Use semester/year in module names for easy identification across terms
Monitor which topics generate the most student questions
Share successful AI tutor prompts with your colleagues
Keep a backup of your system prompts for reuse in future semesters
